alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Rockingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 2:55PM EST until December 24 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain; additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected; wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Augusta and Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM EST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 AM Friday to 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact holiday travel. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Advisory, the highest wind speeds will be Friday into Friday evening. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
